author: ingest-agent
reason: Create a concise source summary of the provided 'tech-stack' document for future reference.

patch.title: tech-stack (source summary)
patch.body_append:
## Summary
Document captures an early-stage **Technical Stack & Decisions** placeholder. All major stack choices are **TBD** across frontend (framework, styling, state management), backend (language, framework, database), infrastructure (hosting, CI/CD, monitoring), and third‑party services/integrations.

The only concrete information is a set of **constraints** shaping future decisions:
- Team size: **2-person team**, with **1 technical** contributor.
- Funding: **pre-funding / bootstrapped**.
- Priority: **speed to market is critical**.

Sections for “Technical Principles” and “Third-Party Services” exist but are not yet filled in. Last updated: **2025-01-23**.

author: ingest-agent
reason: Capture explicit delivery/strategy preference that speed to market is critical.

patch.title: Preference: Speed to market
patch.body_append:
## Statement
Speed to market is critical.

## Implications
When making technical decisions (stack, tooling, infra), prefer options that minimize time-to-first-release and reduce implementation/ops burden, given current team and funding constraints.

## Source
- tech-stack (Last updated 2025-01-23)

author: ingest-agent
reason: Record team/funding constraints as system facts for planning and decision-making.

patch.title: System: Team & funding constraints
patch.body_append:
## Constraints
- Team: 2-person team; 1 technical contributor.
- Funding stage: pre-funding / bootstrapped.

## Notes
These constraints should inform technical scope, tooling choices, and operational complexity.

## Source
- tech-stack (Last updated 2025-01-23)
